page.title: 16ST AEBBA
page.content: THE NAME ST ABBS IS DERIVED FROM PRINCESS AEBBA ,WHO LIVED IN THE SEVENTH CENTURY . SHE WAS THE DAUGHTER OF KING AETHELFRID OF NORTHUMBRIA AND WHILST ESCAPING FROM THE CLUTCHES OF PENDA, THE KING OF MERCIA , HER SHIP WAS SHIPWRECKED NEAR THE HEADLAND , WHICH NOW BEARS HER NAME . TO GIVE THANKS FOR HER SURVIVAL ,SHE BUILT A NUNNERY ON THE HEADLAND NOW KNOWN AS KIRK HILL. IT IS THOUGHT THAT THE REMAINS OF HER BODY WERE PLACED IN THE WALLS OF COLDINGHAM PRIORY .TWO CENTURIES LATER WHEN THE VIKINGS ATTACKED, THE NUNS CUT OF THEIR NOSES TO MAKE THEMSELVES UGLY SO THEY WOULD NOT BE TAKEN . SOON AFTER THE NUNNERY WAS COMPLETELY DESTROYED .ABOUT TWO YEARS THE SITE WAS EXCAVATED BUT ONLY FAINT OUTLINES REMAIN OF THE BUILDINGS AND FIELDS . _
